cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 155 mi ESE of Cabo Gracias a Dios on the Nicaragua/Honduras border
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn northwest, cross the Yucatán Peninsula Saturday night, then track north-northwest across the central Gulf toward the northern Gulf Coast (Louisiana–Texas corridor) early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Louisiana coast (near or west of New Orleans)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in the United States at this time
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in the United States at this time
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire northern Gulf Coast from Texas to the Florida Panhandle lies within the 5-day cone
weather_observation.wind: Only a 4% cumulative chance of tropical-storm-force winds (≥34 kt) over the next five days; strongest winds would be late Monday into Tuesday if the system stays on track.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No surge guidance yet for Louisiana, but surge above 3 ft is possible along SE Louisiana coastline if the system strengthens before landfall.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could reach southeast Louisiana Monday night–Tuesday with potential totals of several inches.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief coastal flooding and hazardous seas in approaches to the Lower Mississippi River are possible as the system nears.
